definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I can't get a dial tone.
Did you hear a dial tone?
We're losing the dial tone, too.
sentences.chinese: 我们也快听不到电话的拨号音了。

sentences.english: The phone must be out of order if you can’t hear a dial tone.
sentences.chinese: 如果听不到拨号音，电话一定是坏了。

sentences.english: And I can't get a proper dialing tone.
sentences.chinese: 我得不到正常的拨号音。

sentences.english: When you hear the dial tone, dail the number.
sentences.chinese: 听到拨号音后，就可以拨号码了。

sentences.english: Yes, it's dead. There's no dial tone.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它毫无声响，没有拨号音。

sentences.english: The wizard could not detect a dial tone .

definition: flag signals (for communicating between ships or army units)/semaphore
to wail/to cry out in distress
oral command/a word of command (used in drilling troops or gymnasts)/password (used by sentry)
